definition: family-like close relationship (idiom)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
as/as if/such as
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: The members of our office get along like a family.
sentences.chinese: 我们办公室的同事亲如一家。

sentences.english: We lived together for more than two years, so came.
sentences.chinese: 我们在一起生活了两年多，所以亲如一家人。

sentences.english: Lennon encourages the world to live as brothers and sisters;
sentences.chinese: 列侬希望世界人民能真正的团结起来，亲如一家。
就像兄弟姐妹亲如一家。

sentences.english: All things are connected like the blood which unites one family.
sentences.chinese: 世间万物皆血脉相连，亲如一家。

sentences.english: Because dreams faith heroes gathered together , they kinship people .
sentences.chinese: 主人公们因为梦想信仰聚在了一起，他们亲如一家人。

sentences.english: Over the years, we as a close, mutual trust, and common progress.
sentences.chinese: 多年以来，我们亲如一家，彼此信任，共同前进。

sentences.english: We the fam and loyalty never change up.
sentences.chinese: 我们亲如一家永不改变。

definition: to live in harmony/to get along with each other
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
(of relations) joyous and harmonious
of one mind (idiom)
to visit frequently/to have frequent dealings (with)/to see each other often
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
peaceful relations/harmonious
deep friendship
to be of one mind/to work as one
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
